FuncDef:
The jitter-packetnum command sets the number of the packets sent each time in a probe for UDP Jitter test.
The undo jitter-packetnum command restores the default number of the packets sent each time in a probe. The jitter-packetnum command sets the number of the packets sent each time in a probe for UDP Jitter test. The undo jitter-packetnum command restores the default number of the packets sent each time in a probe. By default, 20 packets are sent each time in a probe.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of packets sent each time in a probe.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 3000.

ExtraInfo:
When a jitter test instance is used to monitor VoIP services, to set the number of the packets sent each time in a probe, run the jitter-packetnum command. The test simulates actual traffic within a specified period of time.
The jitter-codec command can also be used to simulate VoIP services. The jitter-packetnum command with a parameter configured, however, can implement more finely granular simulation. In addition, the jitter-packetnum command sets the number of packets to be sent for all services, which is widely applied.
